item.title: Active Consumption
item.description: Most consumption is passive: We lean back and let the information wash over us. However, if we actively engage with the content, we tend to retain a lot more.

item.title: Areas of Exploration
item.description: These are the areas I’m planning to explore in Hacking Attention Storytelling Gamification Copywriting Video Creation Community Building Funnel Design Propaganda Design PSYOPs Experience Design Employee Engagement Build In Public Religious Leadership Toastmasters Public Speaking Stand up Comedy Magic Web3 Community Building Game Design Email marketing Influencers Negotiation Specialists Learning Makeup Artists Sales [!

item.title: Atomic Idea
item.description: An Atomic Idea is the fundamental unit of understanding and Learning - the permanently understandable note. My Learning Process involves the creation of Atomic Ideas in the Translation and Rebuild phases.

item.title: Brand
item.description: A brand is the experience people have when they interact with you. It’s the story people heare, not the story we tell.

item.title: Build In Public
item.description: Build In Public is a movement where you are open and vulnerable as you learn and/or create something in public.

item.title: Complain
item.description: Complaining is a mechanism to gain attention. [!Open Questions] Why does complaining work?

item.title: Concept
item.description: Any concept we encounter is a combination of Atomic Ideas organized in a specific way that demonstrate their Relationships. Depending on the Working Resolution, concepts can function as Atomic Ideas.

item.title: Creativity
item.description: Creativity is the original combination of two unoriginal ideas. Algorithmic creativity can often work wonders. A critical ingredient to creativity

item.title: Discovery
item.description: Discovery is exposure to a new entity - an idea, concept, emotion, movement - anything. Types of Discovery Discovery can be:

item.title: ELI5
item.description: This is a learning technique where you explain something to someone as if they were a five year old. This forces you to understand the topic well enough that you can simplify it for somebody else.

item.title: Explosive Questions
item.description: Also called the 6 Horsemen, who, what, when, where, why and how are 6 powerful questions we can use to explode & explore the topic at hand.

item.title: Feynman Technique
item.description: This is a technique developed by Richard Feynman to make sure he understood the Unity and Complexity of a topic.

item.title: Flow
item.description: Flow is a concept introduced by Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi. Flow is a state where our skill level to perform a task matches the complexity of the task we have to complete.

item.title: Friction
item.description: Friction is the difficulty of completing a task or achieving a goal. Though normally we would want to eliminate all friction, sometimes, it’s added on purpose to maintain exclusivity or to trigger Flow.

item.title: Game Design
item.description: This is the science and art of making games. This does not refer to the way the game looks or the programming of the game.

item.title: Gamification
item.description: There are many definitions of gamificaiton, but my preferred one is: Gamification is the art and science of making an experience more game like.

item.title: inflection point
item.description: A point in a story where it undergoes a mutation or variation. In storytelling, these can correlate to story beats and are often created by the Pacing of the story.

item.title: Intellectual Regurgitation
item.description: In an effort to sound smart, people participate in intellectual regurgitation: taking prepackaged opinions and pass it off as their own, bypassing the thinking required to form an opinion.

item.title: Knowledge Storage
item.description: Knowledge Storage is a step of My Learning Process where I add an Atomic Idea to a relevant place in our Mesh of Understanding.

item.title: Learning
item.description: Learning is the act of increasing your understanding something. A good end goal of learning is to understand the Unity and Complexity of a topic.

item.title: Mesh of Understanding
item.description: My Mesh of Understanding is a network of Atomic Ideas connected by Relationships. Mesh of Understanding vs. Knowledge Mesh Wikipedia is a knowledge mesh.

item.title: Message
item.description: The key point of communication [!Open Questions] How do you craft a message?

item.title: Models
item.description: Models are a collection of Atomic Ideas, Concepts and Relationships that explain how something works. They may not be 100% accurate, but are useful in processing the world at a given Working Resolution.

item.title: My Learning Process
item.description: My Learning Process consists of 5 stages: Discovery Teardown Translation Rebuild Knowledge Storage This is a modified version of the Feynman Technique.

item.title: Noise
item.description: Anything that distracts from the Message [!Open Questions]

item.title: Note Taking
item.description: Note taking is a powerful Learning tool and build a Mesh of Understanding. Summmarized below is the mechanical way I execute My Learning Process.

item.title: Pacing
item.description: Pacing is the speed with which the story is moving. [!Open Questions] How do you manipulate pacing?

item.title: Reading
item.description: Reading is how most of us find new things ( Discovery) and learn them. However, not all reading is the same.

item.title: Rebuild
item.description: Once we’ve broken down a Concept or an element of Discovery into Atomic Ideas, you need to put it back together, piece by piece, to see if you can rebuild the whole.

item.title: Relationships
item.description: In the context of Learning, Relationships indicate how two Atomic Ideas are related. Two or more Atomic Ideas with a defined relationship form a Concept.

item.title: Reputation
item.description: A mental image ( Models) of your Brand built up over time. [!Open Questions] How do you build your reputation?

item.title: Signal
item.description: A signal is a way for an entity to convey something to another entity. The world runs on signals and often, signals are used to short circuit our processing and understanding of the world.

item.title: Signal to Noise Ratio
item.description: The ratio of your Signal and Noise in your communication. In ELI5, Signal To Noise Ratio is a measurement of how understandable your Message is.

item.title: Solving Problems
item.description: This is a powerful way to learn. This can also be one of the vectors of Discovery [!Open Questions]

item.title: Storytelling
item.description: Storytelling is an artform as old as civilization. Various frameworks for storytelling exist, with each story beat focusing on a specific Inflection point in the story.

item.title: Surprise
item.description: When the brain expects something and doesn’t receive it, surprise is created. Humour, shock, twists and reframing are all techniques to create surprise.

item.title: Teardown
item.description: Teardown is the act of breaking something down into the atomic components. Note that these atomic components are NOT Atomic Ideas.

item.title: testing
item.description: [!Open Questions]

item.title: The Inbox
item.description: In My Learning Process and in my Note Taking approach, The Inbox is a staging folder where notes are created and worked upon till they’re ready to be added into the Mesh of Understanding.

item.title: Translation
item.description: Translation is the process of understanding the author or creator’s intent and putting it forward in our own words - often into an Atomic Idea or Concept, depending on the Working Resolution.

item.title: Unity and Complexity
item.description: To truly |understand something, I need to follow My Learning Process. This allows me to understand how the individual pieces - the Atomic Ideas work - the “complexity” and how the whole Concept, “the unity” works.

item.title: Working Resolution
item.description: In any situation, there is a minimum threshold of information required for meaningful engagement, defined by the context in which we are operating.
